title: Traitor or legend? How one Poland’s greatest footballers ended up playing for Nazi Germany
description: Daniel Tilles Ernest Wilimowski’s story is one of glory, betrayal and the upheaval of Central Europe’s tragic 20th century.

title: More Poles believe rule of law has worsened under Tusk government than improved
description: The most common answer, given by 34.8%, was that "the situation has got worse" while only 24.4% said it improved.

title: Polish resident of border town takes Germany to court over border controls
description: The measures are intended to prevent illegal immigration, but he says they violate free-movement rules.

title: Polish farmers hold anti-EU protest in Warsaw
description: Organisers say they were opposed to "five dictates from Brussels".

title: Polish researchers create “Map of Monsters” from regional folklore
description: Devils, dragons, mermaids and ghosts are among the mythical creatures depicted on the map of Pomerania.

title: Poland’s minimum wage higher than US federal rate for first time
description: On 1 January, the minimum wage in Poland rose to 30.50 zloty per hour before tax, which at current exchange rates is $7.37, 12 cents above the federal minimum wage in the US.

title: Polish sports star comes out as gay in post mourning death of partner
description: Ski jumper Andrzej Stękała is Poland's first major male athlete to do so.

title: President Duda criticises Polish government in final New Year’s speech
description: President Andrzej Duda has used the final New Year’s Day speech of his presidency to criticise Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s government, accusing it of “causing chaos”, “deepening divisions” and “weakening Polish democracy”. The president has regularly clashed with the ruling coalition during its first year in office after replacing the national-conservative Law and Justice (PiS), […]

title: Poland produced record 29% of power from renewables in 2024
description: Coal continues to be the main source of electricity, accounting for almost 57% of Poland's energy mix, the highest proportion in the EU.

title: Why are Poles so disappointed with the Tusk government?
description: Aleks Szczerbiak Next year's presidential election could turn into a plebiscite on the government.

title: Poland begins EU presidency with focus on security
description: "Security, Europe!" is the slogan of Poland's six months holding the EU's rotational presidency.

title: Poland ends agreement with Russian-based Intersputnik space communication network
description: The decision is part of Poland's strategy to "refrain from cooperation with representatives of Russia".

title: Syrian fighters rescue helicopters
description: The French-made helicopter is one of more than 60 that the Assad regime had before December 2024. It is currently estimated that the vast majority of these machines could have been destroyed in Israeli airstrikes.

title: Ukrainian "aircraft carriers" hit Russian air defense with FPV drones
description: The recording appeared on Sunday, January 6. The video shows an FPV drone flying towards a Russian Pantsir-S1 anti-aircraft system. However, the destruction of a system worth tens of millions of dollars by a disposable FPV drone is not extraordinary.

title: NATO official: financial institutions are acting 'foolishly' by neglecting arms investments
description: Western rating agencies, banks and pension funds are acting "foolishly" by neglecting military investment, NATO military committee chief Adm. Rob Bauer told the Financial Times. Increasing defense spending is a necessity in the face of the growing threat of conflict, he stressed.

title: The AW149 helicopter defined the near future
description: _Sponsored Content_

title: Stryker without ammunition or death under wheels
description: As Ukrainians explain, the situation took place on Russian territory in Kursk Oblast. The crew of an armored Stryker vehicle delivered from the resources of the United States Army operating in Russia got into a fight with Russian troops. At some point, the vehicle's on-board weapons ran out of ammunition.

title: Containing Russia: NATO Focuses on Nuclear Deterrence [INTERVIEW]
description: The nuclear policies of the great powers have been much discussed in recent months, making the strategy of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization particularly relevant in the face of contemporary rivalry. Despite the modernization of Russia’s nuclear arsenal and attempts to use nuclear coercion and blackmail, NATO is constantly strengthening its defense capabilities. The alliance is investing in the modernization of its strategic and tactical nuclear forces and developing conventional military capabilities, such as the F-35A, which increase deterrence. NATO is combining these investments with updated decision-making procedures and transparent communication to minimize the risk of escalation.

title: Pyongyang confirms test of new ballistic missile
description: The missile flew about 1,500 km at 12 times the speed of sound and reached an altitude of 99.8 km before hitting its target during tests supervised by Kim Jong-un through a monitoring system, North Korean news agency KCNA reported.

title: Trump's Ukraine envoy postpones visit to Kyiv
description: “Retired Lt. Gen. Keith Kellogg, who is set to serve as Trump’s special envoy for Ukraine and Russia, had initially planned to travel to Kyiv to meet with Ukrainian officials in early January. His team also arranged meetings with officials in other European capitals, including Rome and Paris,” the agency wrote.

title: Pakistan-Afghan border on fire [COMMENTARY]
description: Pakistan has targeted bases of Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan (TTP) terrorists in Afghanistan, another manifestation of the ongoing tensions in Pakistan-Afghan relations, especially in the border areas.

title: Tuesday's media review; Invitation to partition Russia; Time for NATO action in the Baltic Sea
description:
**Piotr Andrusieczko: Gazeta Wyborcza: "Ukrainians are counterattacking"**
„The Ukrainian army has begun a new phase of operations on Russian territory. On Sunday morning, information about an intensified Ukrainian offensive has been coming in. The first to report this were Russian propaganda war correspondents and bloggers. According to them, Ukrainian forces were attacking north of Sudzha towards the town of Bolshoye Soldatskoye, which is located on the route leading to Kursk. Ukrainian soldiers first used equipment with minesweepers to clear the area to allow tanks and armored personnel carriers to pass through. Russian information also indicates that the Ukrainian side is using powerful electronic warfare (EEW) means, preventing the Russians from using combat drones with wireless communication. The village of Bolshoye Soldatskoye is located 35 kilometers from the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant. Some Russian commentators, as they did in the summer, are again writing that the target of the Ukrainian attack may be a power plant located near Kurchatov. Other Russian bloggers report that the Ukrainians are attacking in several areas. This was confirmed by the head of the Ukrainian Center for Counteracting Disinformation at the Security Council, Andriy Kovalenko. "In Kursk region, the Russians are very worried because they were attacked in several directions and it was a surprise to them. The Defense Forces are working," Kovalenko wrote in Telegram.

title: Russian Defense Ministry: Russian forces have taken over Kurahove in Donbas
description: In mid-December, the independent Russian website Meduza reported that invasion forces had entered the center of Kurakhovy. According to the website, citing a recording posted by a Russian military blogger, the Russian flag was hung on the city government building at the time. On December 6, the Ukrainian project DeepState warned that Russian troops were strengthening around Kurakhovy. The Russians had allegedly captured four villages near the town at the end of last year and were dangerously close to the center.

title: Kursk: Escalation and Counter-Strike. Battle for Suja Approaches [ANALYSIS]
description: Like [Russians in Donbas, who are striving to occupy as much territory as possible](https://defence24.pl/wojna-na-ukrainie-raport-specjalny-defence24/rosyjski-wyscig-z-czasem-w-donbasie-analiza) before Donald Trump's inauguration as US president, Ukrainians are trying at all costs to maintain control of the Kursk breach that was created in August 2024. The situation was complicated by the support that North Korea provided to the Russians last fall. As a result, the Russians managed to approach Sudja. However, in order to delay the attack on that city, Ukrainian forces took new offensive actions on January 5.

title: Russian lessons from Ukraine: Moscow increases its potential [REPORT]
description: The full-scale war against Ukraine that began on February 24, 2022, exposed many shortcomings of the Russian Federation's armed forces, and their capabilities turned out to be much more limited than most analysts had estimated. In the first stage, the Russian Federation's armed forces failed to take Kiev, and the Ukrainian counterattack caused significant losses in equipment for the Russian side. Russia, on the other hand, managed to take selected key cities in the south in early March 2022: Kherson, Melitopol, and - after prolonged urban fighting - also Mariupol in May.

title: Wireless Power: The Future of Warfare
description: Americans have been at the forefront of countries that are constantly racing to develop new military technologies for years. That is why the emergence of new sources of power and energy distribution is not indifferent to them and they are leading the search for future solutions in this area. All the work carried out is based on the Energy Strategy of the US Department of Defense.

title: Czech Republic's Problems with Leopard 2A8 Purchase [COMMENT]
description: In December of last year, information appeared in the Czech media about difficulties in implementing the program to purchase Leopard 2A8 tanks by the local Ministry of Defense. This is said to be due to a smaller than originally planned defense budget for 2025, which is to amount to CZK 154 billion (plus another 6 billion from other departments) instead of the planned 169 billion. In dollars, we are talking about 6.32 billion (plus 246 million) compared to the planned 6.93 billion. Thus, the implementation of several large projects is not at risk, but one of the potential victims is the purchase of the latest version of the Leopard 2.

title: Korean Transporters Parade in America
description: The aforementioned military parade took place in early December, when three-wheeled K808 armored personnel carriers were shown in two types of painting. The most visible here was the central vehicle with typical desert camouflage. Peru has so far purchased 30 K808 personnel carriers (18 and 12 carriers respectively). The selection of this design was announced in May last year as part of a competitive procedure, where the Turkish ARMA 8x8, the American Stryker, the Serbian Lazar III and the Polish KTO Rosomak also participated. Interestingly, the state-owned company FAME S.A.C in cooperation with the South Korean Hyundai Rotem is to be responsible for the implementation of the deliveries.

title: Russia's stockpile of Soviet-era armored vehicles is running low
description: Ukrainian military sources have recently noted that the Russians are using fewer armored vehicles and conducting fewer attacks by mechanized forces towards the city of Kurakhov. This is because the invading forces lost many units of this equipment in October and November 2024, the ISW reported.

title: First recruits join Israeli ultra-Orthodox brigade
description: The Israeli army wants the brigade to become an integral part of the armed forces and expects about 3,000 soldiers to enlist in the coming years, Israeli media reported. "I want to enlist, but it's important for me to feel at home in my unit," one of the first ultra-Orthodox recruits admitted.

title: Israel confirms resumption of talks with Hamas
description: Israel confirmed on Saturday the resumption of indirect negotiations with Hamas in Qatar aimed at freeing hostages held in the Gaza Strip, the AFP news agency reported.

title: HUR attacks again
description: Ukrainian intelligence reported that the explosion occurred on Friday. The target of the attack was 29-year-old Nagaiko, who was serving in his unit at the time. The soldier suffered numerous injuries to "almost all of his organs," primarily the brain, HUR reported.

title: Ukraine counterattacks in Kursk
description: According to unconfirmed information, the Ukrainians have launched an attack in the north-east direction, including from the Sudzha region towards Bolshoye Soldatskoye. The attack is to be supported by electronic warfare means, which have managed to disable some of the Russian drones, but fiber-optic guided systems, insensitive to interference, are also being used against Ukrainian forces. The few photos from the area of ​​operations show armored vehicles with protection (nets) protecting against drone strikes.

title: Indian Fighter of the Future – Indigenous or International?
description: The proposals were submitted by both consortiums with links to European industry: [German-French-Spanish FCAS/SCAF](https://defence24.pl/przemysl/fcas-to-nie-europejski-samolot-przyszlosci-analiza) (Future Combat Air System) and [British-Italian-Japanese GCAP](https://defence24.pl/technologie/farnborough-2024-wielkie-skrzydla-gcap-a) (Global Combat Air Programme). **The Americans did not make a similar proposal,** who are currently struggling with redefining [their own NGAD project](https://defence24.pl/technologie/mysliwiec-szostej-generacji-za-drogi-redefinicja-programu-ngad) (Next Generation Air Dominance), and at the same time are working on [the naval F/A-XX](https://defence24.pl/sily-zbrojne/nowy-mysliwiec-us-navy-zagrozony). It seems likely that they will [never share](https://defence24.pl/technologie/amerykanie-pomoga-stworzyc-indyjski-mysliwiec-przyszlosci) the technologies created within it, just as they did not do so in the case of the [F-22 Raptor](https://defence24.pl/technologie/nowe-uzbrojenie-i-mozliwosci-f-22-raptor-analiza).

title: Israeli Army on alert due to Iranian threat
description: The service, citing an anonymous source in the Israeli security services, emphasized that such a decision was made in view of the unfavorable - from Iran's perspective - regional and domestic situation. In the opinion of the Israeli side, this could prompt Tehran to escalate tensions.

title: Germany: Scholz-Putin meeting possible before elections
description: The Christian Democratic Union politician noted in a social media post that "Ukraine cannot lose its subjectivity or become a victim". "Any negotiations and agreements that will be concluded in the current situation would be detrimental to Ukraine's interests and would de facto mean its submission" - assessed Kiesewetter

title: A rare tank in service in Ukraine
description: The T-80UD (Object 478B) main battle tank was adopted by the USSR Armed Forces in 1987, it is a modification of the T-80U (Object 219AS) tank developed by the Leningrad Kirov Plant. The T-80UD was created at the Kharkov Morozov Machine-Building and Design Bureau, which operates at the Malyshev Plant. The T-80UD was modified in relation to the T-80U, by replacing the engine, instead of the GTD-1250 gas turbine generating 1250 hp, a two-stroke diesel engine with opposed pistons 6TD-1 was installed, generating 1000 hp. Additionally, the commander received a new observation cupola with a remotely controlled 1EC29M position for the NSWT large-caliber machine gun.

title: Latest AMRAAMs for Japan
description: The two versions of these radar-guided missiles are in question: the AIM-120D-3 and the AIM-120C-8. The potential allowable value of the contract is a maximum of $3.64 billion. The subject of the agreement is up to 1,200 AMRAAM missiles of both versions, up to 20 guidance sections of the D-3 version and four of the C-8 version. In addition, there are propulsion sections, warheads, training missiles and other elements of the logistics and training packages.

title: Marder at War: The "Workhorse" of Panzer Grenadiers Defends Ukraine
description: (Editor's note: The Marder 1 IFV was the basic armament of the German mechanized infantry, i.e. the panzer grenadiers, since the 1970s. It has now been partially replaced by the Puma IFV. Although the Germans scrapped or sold most of the over 2,000 vehicles originally produced for the Bundeswehr, some of the preserved vehicles are being transferred to Ukraine).

title: The Leaky Resistance Front and Trump: What Awaits Iran in 2025?
description: Just 12 months ago, the authorities of the Islamic Republic of Iran had reason to be pleased, as successes were noted in various areas, to a greater or lesser extent. The strategic partnership with Russia flourished, and Iranian drones were discussed in the media around the world. Relative peace reigned in Syria, and President Bashar al-Assad still held power there, seemingly unchallenged.

title: Taiwanese company helps Russia produce aircraft bombs
description: These modules allow for the conversion of a regular gravity-dropping aerial bomb into a precision gliding bomb. As reported by the intelligence group InformNapalm, citing Vadim Labas, a volunteer, the Taiwanese company TRC has made a large contribution to the production of control modules. TRC specializes in the production of suspension elements and parts used in the automotive industry. However, for some time now the Taiwanese company has been involved - consciously or not - in the production of Russian UMPK modules.

title: USA: 155mm Anti-Drone Guns Coming Soon
description: The U.S. Army's Rapid Capabilities and Critical Technologies Office (RCCTO) announced its intention to order prototypes of the 155 mm Multi-Domain Artillery Cannon (MDAC) and the Hypervelocity Projectile (HVP) projectile designed for it from BAE Systems Land & Armaments L.P. of Minneapolis.

title: Restless night in Russia and Ukraine. Drones and ATACAMS shot down
description: Russian authorities reported the downing of 72 Ukrainian drones and eight ATAMCS missiles on the night of Friday to Saturday (January 3-4). In turn, Ukrainian defense reported the downing of 34 of the 81 drones launched by Russia on the night of Friday to Saturday. Four civilians (residents of the Kherson region) were injured in the attacks. What happened to the remaining drones? According to the Ukrainian army, the remaining 47 drones "disappeared from radars thanks to electronic warfare systems".

title: Will the war in Ukraine last until 2027?
description: “I am analyzing not only Putin’s statements, but also the work of the Russian military-industrial complex, the country’s economic potential, and the emphasis on defense and continued military operations throughout 2025,” Kowalenko explained.

title: War of the paradoxes
description: The third year of the war is coming to an end, the rationalization of which poses a challenge even to Russian propaganda, and the number of paradoxes associated with it is by no means decreasing.

title: "New-Old" Speaker of the House of Representatives
description: Mike Johnson has been the Speaker of the House of Representatives since October 2023. In the vote that took place on Friday, January 3, he received 218 votes, which is exactly what the required absolute majority was. Johnson's main rival, Hakeem Jeffries (Democratic Party), received 215 votes. The new majority leader in the Senate is Senator John Thune from South Dakota.

title: The Last Dance at Ramstein
description: On Thursday, January 9, a meeting of countries involved in military support for Ukraine will take place at the American air base in Ramstein. This will be the last time that members of the administration of US President Joe Biden will participate in this format. The meeting in Ramstein will be chaired by the outgoing US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin.

title: Prosecutor's Office: Investigation launched into Antoni Macierewicz's "diplomatic betrayal"
description: The accusation of "diplomatic treason" against the PiS politician and former head of the Ministry of National Defense was formulated by the head of the Military Counterintelligence Service, General Jarosław Stróżyk, in October, when he presented the report of the commission for the study of Russian and Belarusian influences, of which he is the head. At that time, he announced that the relevant documents had been forwarded to the prosecutor's office.

title: Gen. Mirosław Bodnar heads the Unmanned Systems Inspectorate
description: In an interview with Defence24.pl, MON spokesman Janusz Sejmej confirmed that Brig. Gen. Mirosław Bodnar has been appointed to the position of Unmanned Systems Inspector at the General Command of the Armed Forces. Formally, the Unmanned Systems Inspectorate has been operating since January 1 of this year, although of course its formation and creation of appropriate structures are still ongoing.

title: Another American armored brigade in Poland
description: In the port of Gdynia, the US Navy transport ship USNS "Red Cloud" has begun unloading heavy equipment belonging to the 1st Armored Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division of the US Army. This division is one of the first to receive the latest equipment. In the photos, we can see, among others, M1A2SEPv3 Abrams main battle tanks and JLTV armored cars in various variants. The 1st Armored Brigade is also equipped with M2A4 Bradley infantry fighting vehicles and technically related vehicles from the AMPV family.

title: The patrolling Silesian transforms into a combat Rook
description: The document published on December 30, 2024 by the Armament Agency informs about the intention to carry out a thorough modernization of the ORP "Ślązak" patrol corvette, or more precisely: "to equip the ORP "Ślązak" patrol corvette with weapon systems and additional equipment". This entire operation is to be preceded by preliminary market consultations, which will later allow for the preparation of a description of the subject of the order, and therefore also for determining the required budget. The Armament Agency has set a high pace in this respect, because entities interested in participating in the program have time to submit the necessary documentation only until January 17, 2025.

title: Kamikaze drones in the 1st Warsaw Armored Brigade
description: The training organized in the 1st Warsaw Armored Brigade covered a number of issues related to FPV platforms. As the unit reports via social media, soldiers trained in, among other things, piloting, construction, and attacking. The exercises discussed "independent construction and repair, correct flight technique, performing kamikaze combat flights and remote launching of charges, organization of work of the drone section, use of drones in conditions of counteracting the enemy's EW."

title: Ammunition directed to Langusta and Homar
description: The Polish Army uses 75 WR-40 Langusta multiple rocket launchers and a number of Soviet BM-21 Grad and Czechoslovak RM-70/85. The latter two will be completely replaced in the next few years by the much more modern Homary-K and Homary-A. According to the plans of the Ministry of National Defense, both of the above systems are to be integrated with the Polish 122 mm Feniks-Z ammunition. **This family of combat assets will therefore be used in the Polish Army for many decades,** which is a contribution to its modernization. Such a proposal was presented by the Warsaw University of Technology during the International Artillery Conference.

title: Sabotage disrupted ammunition supplies
description: The guerrillas carried out sabotage on January 2, 2025, on the line near the town of Stara Toropa. This line is used to transport ammunition from two depots of the Main Missile and Artillery Directorate of the Russian Defense Ministry (GRAU) - the 23rd and 107th.

title: North Korean soldiers gain "experience"
description: Single pages from a soldier's notebook have been appearing since before the holiday season. At that time, the Ukrainian Special Forces showed a page with a hand-drawn drawing depicting "fighting drones". The latest disclosed notes reveal a bit more about the very purpose for which North Korean soldiers are fighting and dying in Ukraine. According to the notes of the fallen soldier, it is about "experience" that they will gain and be able to use in a potential war.

title: Birth in the Warsaw unit
description: As we learn from the 1WBP social media, on January 2, the unit's duty service had to cope with an unusual task. One of the soldiers of the DSW specialist training, voluntarily barracked on the unit's premises, began to give birth. Colleagues reacted quickly, calling an ambulance and providing the necessary assistance to the future mother. The delivery was quick and without major complications, the mother and the new recruit are feeling great. The entire unit is already starting to prepare a layette for the girl. As we learn unofficially, an assignment to communications is being prepared, "people need to be united, not divided" - the soldiers admit.

title: "Where Did the 155th Brigade Go?" A Wave of Desertions and the Remnants at Pokrovsk
description: “The Worst Year of the War” – this is how I titled the summary of the last few months on the front. Unfortunately, the case of the 155th Anna Kyivska Brigade caused a huge stir in Ukraine and confirmed that things were going badly on the Ukrainian side of the front. The case will also resonate in Ukrainian-French relations. President Emmanuel Macron recently experienced a pro-Ukrainian awakening. He stopped calling Vladimir Putin and became a second Napoleon Bonaparte, encouraging resistance to Russia, being in the vanguard of European leaders in the defense of Ukraine. The fruit of this transformation was the project of training and arming the 155th Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces by France. The numbering of the brigade itself was unlucky, because when I read that the French would train the “155”, I thought that they should not end up like the Russian marines. Let me remind you that the Russian 155th Marine Brigade was approximately 80 percent destroyed during the current war.

title: Honduras threatens the United States. In the background is a U.S. Army base
description: Honduran President Xiomara Castro's New Year's address has reverberated widely in the world media. All because of words about mass deportations and the American military base in Palmerola. President Castro's declaration is unequivocal - if the United States decides to mass deport Honduran citizens (according to official Honduran data, there are about 270,000 people from this country illegally staying in the US), the authorities in Tegucigalpa will decide to close the American base in Palmerola (central Honduras, about 400 military personnel).

title: EU: Poland will seek EU support for Ukraine
description: In an interview with an Italian agency published on Thursday, the Polish diplomat stressed that achieving a just peace in Ukraine requires "hard work from everyone."

title: Zelensky: Putin is doing everything to avoid sitting down to negotiate with me
description: Vladimir Putin does not want any dialogue with Ukraine and is looking for ways to avoid direct talks on ending the war. Only Donald Trump can stop Putin, President Volodymyr Zelensky said in a television interview on Thursday.

title: Israel Confirms Commando Raid in Syria [COMMENTARY]
description: The Israeli side confirmed that it carried out a commando raid on underground facilities in Syria last year. The targets were primarily installations necessary for the production of missile systems intended for Hezbollah.

title: South Korea: Military 'protects' suspended president
description: Officers from the Bureau for the Investigation of Corruption Among High-Placed Officials entered the president's residence but were "blocked by a military unit," Yonhap reports. The arrest warrant was issued Tuesday by a Seoul court in connection with the president's imposition of martial law in early December. Jun has repeatedly refused to appear for questioning and has prevented searches of his office, hampering an investigation into whether his imposition of martial law was a rebellion.

title: Expansion of Ukrainian companies in Poland. Are we a base on the way to conquer the European Union?
description: The Russian invasion of 2022 forced many Ukrainians to flee their country. Some of them turned their life crisis into a business success and are successfully developing their companies in Central Europe. And there are many indications that Ukrainian businessmen are planning further expansion to the West.

title: Germany to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP? Scholz: It's immature
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz described the proposal of Economy Minister Robert Habeck to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP as "immature". Who will pay for the increase in the defense budget from almost 80 to 140 billion euros? The citizens? - asked the head of the German government in an interview with the weekly "Stern".

title: Brutal Neo-Nazis Rise to Power in Wartime Russia, Terrorizing Russian Streets
description: Neo-Nazis in Russia have grown in strength and already have hundreds of thousands of supporters. This group no longer fears government repression, so it terrorizes Russian streets. Videos showing spectacular violence are a hit on the web, and official media support the neo-Nazi xenophobic narrative - we read in Jacobin.

title: Strange behavior of the Russians. General Skrzypczak: That's clever. They will cut off the city soon
description: The Russians have used a new tactic that is already bringing them their first successes. Thanks to it, the front around Pokrovsk is starting to look like a sandwich and the Ukrainians themselves are warning that it is sometimes difficult to tell where the enemy is and where the allied forces are. General Waldemar Skrzypczak has no doubt that the Russians' idea is very good and, unfortunately, may soon lead to the fall of the great city.

title: Poland has the second lowest unemployment in the EU. New data available
description: 3 percent - that was the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate in Poland in November - Eurostat reported. A month earlier, this indicator was 3.1 percent. For comparison, in the eurozone, unemployment in November was 6.3 percent.

title: Companies are fighting for employees. These industries will now hire
description: Companies from the transport and logistics and automotive industries are announcing an increase in employment in the coming months - according to a report by ManpowerGroup. Four out of ten companies are planning new recruitments in the first quarter of this year.

title: NATO Representative Sternly to Banks: What Happened to Your Business Instinct? Have You Gone Stupid?
description: Western rating agencies, banks and pension funds are acting "foolishly" by disregarding arms investments, senior NATO representative Adm. Rob Bauer told the Financial Times. Increasing defense spending is a necessity in the face of the growing threat of conflict, he emphasized.

title: Russians are furious with the Chinese. These weapons are literally burning in their hands
description: The Russians do not hide their fury, but this time they are not directing their emotions towards the West, but China. The silent ally that was supposed to support them and help them bypass Western sanctions has provided military equipment that is falling apart. Not only is it helping less and less in combat, but the Russians are warning that it may even be dangerous to the lives of soldiers.

title: Crazy disparity on Wall Street. Profits of 7 largest companies increased by 18%, other 493 by... 0.1%
description: The US stock exchange has two years of impressive growth behind it. The S&P 500 index gained over 20% in 2023 and 2024. However, it has a problem of huge concentration - the entire Wall Street is pulling a few companies on its shoulders. The profits of the 7 largest companies increased by 18% in the third quarter, the remaining 493 by... 0.1%.

title: What's next for butter prices? Strong assurance from the agriculture minister
description: A product that has recently attracted the public's attention has been the rising price of butter. On Tuesday, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Czesław Siekierski, assured that butter prices will fall. In his opinion, this is already visible in the agreements that are concluded in advance. The Minister recalled that the Ministry of Agriculture opposes the EU-Mercosur agreement and assured that Deputy Minister of Agriculture Michał Kołodziejczak will not resign.

title: Thick atmosphere in the Far East? Japan wants to buy over 1,000 missiles from the US
description: The Americans have agreed to a potential sale of AIM-120 AMRAAM air-to-air missiles to Japan. The authorities of the cherry blossom country have expressed a desire to buy as many as 1,200 of these missiles. This is not the first such request in recent years. What can this weapon do? What air force does Japan have?

title: Shares of Chinese giant collapsed. Reason? It became a "military company"
description: China's Tencent has been included by the US Department of Defense on the list of "Chinese military companies". The shares of the technology giant immediately dived - writes CNBC.

title: Russia has a big problem. They won with this weapon. Now it can change
description: It is difficult to point out a miracle weapon that will single-handedly change the course of war. However, there are some that are of key importance today. During the Ukrainian conflict, we can mention the M142 HIMARS launchers on the Ukrainian side and FAB guided bombs with UMPK modules on the Russian side. However, there are many indications that the Russians now have a serious problem with them.

title: BRICS is growing stronger as the world's fourth largest country by population joins the bloc
description: Indonesia has been admitted as a full member of the BRICS bloc of developing nations, Brazil, which holds the presidency until 2025, announced on Monday.

title: Trump Wants Canada to Join the US, But Canadians Have a Completely Different Opinion [POLL]
description: Many people in Canada want it to become the 51st state of the USA, and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced his resignation because he knew that Washington would not tolerate trade deficits and subsidies, assessed Donald Trump, commenting on Trudeau's decision. He added that the USA and Canada would create a great country together.

title: The biggest tax hits and misses. Ruthless analyses by renowned experts. Optimism mixed with pessimism
description: As experts on the subject argue, the past year brought few tax changes for companies. On the other hand, the postponement of the implementation date of the National e-Invoice System (KSeF), which was to be in force from mid-2024, is primarily received positively. The advantages also include a lower VAT rate in the beauty industry, cash PIT for the smallest companies and the minimum CIT tax. The latter is also on the list of disadvantages. Next to it, you can see, among others, the property tax or the act increasing the excise tax rate on tobacco products.

title: Trump's son to visit Greenland. Media: It's humiliation for Danish government
description: The son of US President-elect Donald Trump, businessman Donald Trump Junior, will visit Greenland on Tuesday and meet with local politicians who support the island's independence, Greenlandic and Danish media reported on Monday.

title: Warsaw worse than Berlin. Here is the ranking of the most congested cities in the world
description: City traffic jams are a nightmare for all drivers around the world. However, drivers in Istanbul, New York and Chicago suffer the most from this - according to a report prepared by Inrix. Inrix's list of the most congested cities in the world also includes seven Polish cities. Check how they fared.

title: Canadian PM resigns. 'The situation has been building for several years'
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Monday that he will step down as party leader and thus cease to be prime minister. However, he will serve in his role until his successor is elected.

title: Will Europe be flooded with cheap food from South America? Another group of companies fears the EU-Mercosur agreement
description: Meat producers in Spain and Europe fear unfair competition if the European Union's agreement with Mercosur, an economic organization of South American countries, comes into force, the Spanish daily "ABC" wrote on Monday.

title: Ukrainian Naval Drones Attack Russian Air Defenses! Poland Should Learn from the Revolution in Naval Warfare
description: Ukrainian Armed Forces have destroyed another Russian Pantsir-S1 anti-aircraft system, this time using an FPV drone launched from an unmanned combat boat. The attack carried out in the Kherson region demonstrates the growing effectiveness of Ukrainian naval drones. The event confirms that even countries without a traditional navy can effectively conduct combat operations at sea.

title: Volkswagen wants to invest in China. 20,000 fast-charging stations to be built
description: The largest German car manufacturer, which is in a difficult situation, does not give up and takes a new initiative in China, the world's largest car market. Volkswagen and Xpeng have announced plans to expand their partnership. They will jointly build a network of super-fast charging stations for electric vehicles in the Middle Kingdom.

title: Will Austria Become Like Hungary? Expert: Chancellor Candidate Inspired by Orbán
description: After entrusting the mission of forming a government to the leader of the pro-Russian FPOe party, Herbert Kickl, "there is a significant risk of a course correction in Austria's foreign policy," Jakub Bielamowicz from the Institute for New Europe assessed in an interview with PAP. He also recalled that Kickl is inspired by Viktor Orban.

title: They made a fool of the owners of gas and oil furnaces with money. Is this a scandal that could end in a court war?
description: Those who bought gas and oil furnaces were fooled. Why? Because until the end of last year, they could have withdrawn the money invested in the purchase, installation and connection of such boilers from the tribute due to the tax office. Now it turns out that at the beginning of 2025, such boilers disappeared from the list of expenses covered by tax relief. Will the owners of gas and oil furnaces go to court? The point is that an error was made in the regulations.

title: They are giving 600 plus for a dentist from the new year. A big change in dental treatment "on the National Health Fund" What to do to get this money?
description: Those who can't afford it have ruin in their mouths, those who have money spend a fortune in a private office, where the prices are jaw-dropping. This is what dental treatment looks like in our country. And few people know that paying a health insurance contribution means that we don't always have to pay for everything. This year there has been a big change in the basket of dental benefits under the National Health Fund. You can get 600 plus for a dentist.

title: A revolution in the use of photovoltaics. Free electricity from the sun in a new way. Important changes have come into force for owners of solar panels
description: They have become a real hit in Poland. For several years now, there has been a boom in the installation of home installations for the production of electricity. The problem is that investing in free electricity from the sun is becoming more and more expensive. Will the amendment to the Renewable Energy Sources Act, which came into force on December 27, change this? The new regulations bring prosumers back to a settlement system based on the average monthly price of electricity.

title: They brought a giant machine from the end of the world. This is how they will dig the longest tunnel in Poland through the mountains [PHOTOS]
description: It is almost five meters in diameter, weighs six hundred tons and requires thirty trucks to transport it. This giant is a Chinese machine that will carve the longest tunnel in Poland under the mountains, near Limanowa. Construction will start soon, because the machine has already arrived in Poland from the port in Shanghai.

title: Is this how you make a profitable bank deposit from Employee Capital Plans? There is a simple way to outsmart the system
description: Will future retirees no longer live in poverty? The Employee Capital Plans system is a safeguard in old age. This long-term savings program, which is made up of employers, the state and employees themselves, was launched over four years ago. Now it turns out that some have treated it as a simple way to make money. PPK have become a short-term... bank deposit, but with a profit that is many times greater.

title: This has never happened before! Polish company takes over German giant. This is a deal worth billions
description: The whole series of sad news about our companies being taken over by foreign corporations makes me want to cry. Now, finally, there is some optimism. A Polish company is buying a German giant. The transaction concerns the tourism industry that generates billions of euros in profits every year.

title: Mysterious Polish businessman at the top of stock market billionaires. You won't believe what he built his gigantic success on
description: He challenged the largest foreign chains. He successfully competes with the Portuguese Bieronki of the Jeronimo Martins group. He already has more stores than the German Lidl. He made a real fortune in trade, which brought him to the top of the list of the wealthiest Poles. Now he is at the top of the list of stock market billionaires. Although the largest Polish media write about the state of the account of the owner of the Dino chain, Tomasz Biernacki, he himself remains a mystery. No one knows what he looks like. He avoids the media like the plague and does not give interviews. Journalists have no access to him.

title: They will ban the installation of gas stoves. It has already been decided. They have already indicated the date
description: Social campaigns, government subsidies from the "Clean Air" program, the Polish Smog Alert, which strikes alarmist tones, for several years we have had a popular uprising in Poland regarding the replacement of old stoves with gas boilers. Now it turns out that the EU wants to introduce a ban on installing them in homes.

title: The tax office will get to our December salaries. Some will have their salaries cut
description: "A man won't let a living man go..." the words of this old cabaret song fit the tax office like a glove. The tax office has no mercy. It can even look under the Christmas tree. It turns out that some people will have to pay tax on a gift received from their employer. The December paycheck may be lower than expected.

title: Public holidays in 2025. Here's when the long weekends will be. We'll show you how to plan your vacation wisely.
description: In 2025, we will work two days less than in 2024. This is because it is one day shorter, and after two we will get Christmas Eve off. The total number of hours worked in full-time employment will be 1992. This is 16 hours less than in 2024.

title: Catastrophe! Everyone goes to them. Doctors of this specialty "for the fund" do not want to treat anymore, in private practices they raise prices. It is expensive, it will be even more expensive
description: The deadlines are so distant that there is no chance of quick treatment, and the clinics are worse equipped, this is what free dental care "for the fund" looks like. Those who cannot afford it have ruin in their mouths, those who have money pay a lot to a private dentist. It is expensive, and it will get even more expensive. The increase in prices at dentists may exceed 10 percent year on year.

title: Donations targeted by tax authorities: This one mistake could end in financial disaster
description: Can a tax-free gift given by parents to children end up in trouble with the tax office? It turns out that yes. Because the tax office seizes on every pretext to question the relief. It has no mercy for formal errors.

title: Changes are coming to the Polish labor market in 2025. And it's not good news
description: Slower wage growth, accelerated automation and artificial intelligence, visible wage brackets and a persistent staff shortage – these are the key trends that employers and employees will face in 2025. The year that is ending has brought a lot of changes and uncertainty, which has left its mark on the labor market. Personnel Service has taken a closer look at the main phenomena to assess which of them will dominate the next year and which are only temporary.

title: "Realistic expectations regarding territory". Kiev will not be pleased with Emmanuel Macron's words
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he sees no quick or easy solution to the conflict in Ukraine. In his opinion, Kiev should therefore have "realistic" expectations regarding the territory.

title: Political Earthquake in Austria: Pro-Russian Party on a Mission to Form Government
description: Austrian President Alexander Van der Bellen has entrusted the mission of forming a new government to Herbert Kickl – leader of the pro-Russian Freedom Party of Austria (FPOe). Will Kickl succeed in forming a new cabinet?

title: Millions of Ukrainians abroad. Will the authorities force them to return? There is a comment from the minister
description: Ukrainian National Unity Minister Oleksiy Chernyshov has clearly announced what the government will do regarding Ukrainians who have left the country. According to the ministry, there are currently 20-25 million Ukrainians abroad.

title: Russians were preparing a "bloody provocation". The target was a Ukrainian military unit
description: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has thwarted a Russian bloody provocation in the Kyiv region, the SBU reported on social networks on Monday. As explained, an agent of the Russian services allegedly blew himself up in a military unit as a gesture of protest.

title: Musk's "Monstrous Problem": "Politico" Warns: He Could Influence Poland's Elections
description: Politico believes that Brussels finding a way to prevent Elon Musk from interfering in EU countries' politics is a "terrible problem". According to the website, Musk can influence, among other things, the presidential elections in Poland.

title: Increased German checks and accidents. Gigantic traffic jams at the border with Germany
description: Drivers traveling toward Germany must arm themselves with patience. Accidents and tightened checks by German services are creating gigantic traffic jams.

title: Operation Gear. Less Black in the Polish Army and Uniforms for Women
description: Soldiers' individual equipment plays an important role on the battlefield today. In the Polish Army, we are still struggling with a number of problems related to it. This is to be changed by Operation Gear, which involves the acquisition of new helmets, vests and uniforms. The army has lifted the veil of secrecy about the planned changes.

title: Norwegian PM criticizes Elon Musk. "It's worrying..."
description: Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Stoere warns against the involvement of American billionaire Elon Musk in elections in Western countries. In his opinion, this is not how relations between allies should look like.

title: Russia captures the city of Kurahove. Ukraine attacks in Kursk region
description: The Russian Defense Ministry today officially confirmed the capture of the city of Kurahove, a key city in the southwestern part of Donbas. Meanwhile, Ukraine has taken the offensive in Russia's Kursk region.

title: Heavy losses for Koreans. This is how Moscow will repay Pyongyang for its soldiers
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken confirmed during a visit to Seoul that at least a thousand North Korean soldiers have been killed or wounded in fighting with Ukraine. He also revealed how Moscow will repay Pyongyang...

title: French Mirage fighters fly to Ukraine! Kyiv will receive the planes in January
description: According to the reliable French industry portal Avionslegendaires, Ukraine is on the verge of strengthening its air fleet. The first Mirage 2000-5F fighters are set to reach the Ukrainian Air Force by the end of January 2025. The initial delivery will include three aircraft, which is the first step in implementing the Franco-Ukrainian military agreement.

title: Bad news for Chancellor Scholz's party and the liberals. Support for the AfD is not falling. The latest poll from Germany
description: Seven weeks before the Bundestag elections, the CDU/CSU has the greatest support in Germany, followed by the right-wing populist AfD.

title: The US is moving thousands of soldiers to Poland. Heavy equipment was unloaded in Gdynia
description: Heavy equipment from the American 3rd Infantry Division was unloaded in Gdynia. The soldiers arrived in Poland as part of the rotational presence of American forces. Along with 3.5 thousand Americans, tanks, armored personnel carriers and artillery arrived in our country.

title: Five years after COVID-19 pandemic, hMPV infections surge in China
description: Chinese doctors have recorded a sharp increase in metapneumovirus (hMPV) infections in the country, the country's health authorities have reported. The increase in cases is mainly affecting children under the age of 14 and is most noticeable in northern regions of China, the British portal of the Independent daily reported.

title: The gas lamps in the Cloth Hall are shining again
description: After a break of over 3 years, the arcades of the Cloth Hall are once again decorated with the light of 36 historic gas lamps. Their conservation renovation, for which the Municipal Buildings Board was responsible, has just been completed.

title: Warming only temporary, winter will return soon. Forecasts predict snowfall and frost
description: Although the current weather is more like the beginning of spring than winter, a dramatic change is coming soon. The several-degree warmth will give way to Arctic air, which will bring frost and snowfall. As forecasters predict, a cooling will appear in the second half of the week.

title: OMZRiK notifies prosecutor's office regarding famous influencer. "He seduced a child"
description: Robert Pasut is a controversial figure on the Polish internet. This time, he has once again found himself in the spotlight of the Center for Monitoring Racist and Xenophobic Behavior (OMZRiK). The organization warns that it has collected irrefutable evidence that may incriminate the well-known patostreamer.

title: Strong slap at Iga Świątek. "You can't be a victim when you break the rules!"
description: Iga Świątek's fans will not forget this story for a long time. The Polish player had a doping mishap that shocked the sports world (doping control showed the presence of the banned substance trimetazidine). And although the press in our country treated the former WTA ranking leader quite gently, Iga still carries a rather large thorn in her heart. And it is not the Poles who attack her the most, but someone completely different! Now, more strong words have been spoken towards our tennis player.

title: He withdrew a large amount of cash and disappeared. The police are looking for him
description: He withdrew a large amount of cash in a Warsaw shopping mall and disappeared. The man is wanted by the police. His image has been published.

title: Big brawl: Tesla owners trapped in huge queues
description: A dramatic situation unfolded in Malung, Sweden, during a weekend tourist exchange at the popular ski resort of Salen. Gigantic queues formed at Tesla electric car charging stations, forcing hundreds of travelers to wait for hours in 20-degree frost.

title: Politico: Musk a "monstrous problem" for the EU. In the background, the impact on the presidential election in Poland
description: Elon Musk, the owner of the X platform (formerly Twitter), is once again at the center of controversy. The European Union faces a serious challenge of how to respond to his activity. According to Politico, Musk's promotion of right-wing forces in Europe is becoming a "monstrous problem" for EU officials. How to respond to Musk's growing political influence is now one of the key questions.

title: Michniewicz to return to bench? An unexpected direction for the former coach
description: Czesław Michniewicz to return to coaching? According to media reports, the former coach of the Polish national team will once again try to work in Africa. This time, he is to take over the 14-time champions of Algeria.

title: Jennifer Aniston Impresses With Her Figure at Age 55: "This Workout Transformed My Body. Less Is More"
description: Jennifer Aniston is in great shape at 55. Excessive rigor can be detrimental to your health, as the Hollywood star and legendary Rachel from "Friends" learned the hard way. Today, she takes a more gentle approach and is happy with her body transformation despite - or maybe because of - less intense workouts. Nutrition also plays a role - Jennifer Aniston starts each day with a special drink.

title: He showed what is happening at Morskie Oko. He warns tourists
description: Winter in the Tatras can be beautiful, but it poses many dangers that tourists don't always remember. Every year, videos of mountain climbers dressed inappropriately for the weather appear on the web. But inappropriate clothing is not the only risky behavior on the trail. A recording has just appeared on the Tatra National Park's Facebook page, warning against another type of recklessness.

title: What can you get a ticket for on a ski slope? The police see everything. Up to 5 thousand PLN fine!
description: Poles love to ski down the slopes. Sometimes, however, having fun can get too much to your head, leading to serious consequences, including legal ones. What can skiers and snowboarders get a ticket for?

title: Former finance ministers asked about PiS subsidy. This is how they would behave
description: We still don't know whether Law and Justice will receive a subsidy. The Minister of Finance, Andrzej Domański, has not yet announced a decision in this matter. "Fakt" decided to find out how the politician's predecessors in the aforementioned office would have behaved in such a situation. What did we hear?

title: Father Marek was rushing to Mass. Moving words of the faithful after the accident in Chmielek
description: Father Marek Tworek, parish priest in Chmielek (Lublin Province), was rushing to the mass he was supposed to lead. He did not want to disappoint his parishioners, to keep them waiting. So he took a risky maneuver. The last one in his life. The priest died after his car hit a roadside embankment. The words of the faithful are the best evidence of how popular a priest he was.

title: Scandal in Brussels. Ukrainians did not show up for talks
description: The European Commission has canceled a meeting scheduled for Tuesday on gas transit from Russia to Slovakia. The decision was made due to the absence of Ukrainian representatives, the government office in Bratislava reported on Monday. The statement said the EC was seeking a new date for the talks.

title: This is how much Paweł Wąsek earned for the Four Hills Tournament. The amount may be surprising
description: Paweł Wąsek did not disappoint and was definitely the best of the Poles during the 73rd Four Hills Tournament. However, he is a far cry from the winner of the TCS. At least in terms of finance.

title: Itchy under your armpit? This could indicate these tumors
description: Itchy armpits are an embarrassing and unpleasant problem. Often, it is a harmless skin defect, but there are also certain types of cancer that can cause itchy armpits. Especially if scratching does not help and the symptom does not go away. We explain what factors to look out for.

title: The End of an Iconic Store. It Was a Legendary Place in Warsaw
description: In early January 2025, the history of one of the most recognizable places in Warsaw will come to an end. The characteristic neon sign of Sezam, which has been an inseparable element of the capital's landscape for over five decades, will go out forever.

title: A dangerous incident in Kashubia. Someone shot at a car and a building. The police are asking for help.
description: A serious incident occurred on Monday (6 December) in Pępowo (Kartuski district, Pomeranian province). A man reported to the police station that someone had shot at his car. As it turned out later, a window of the building near which the car was parked was also damaged. The police appeal to anyone who has any information on this matter.

title: These are Barcelona's biggest problems. Does Lewandowski have anything to worry about?
description: The beginning of the season and Robert Lewandowski's series of goals are now just the past. The present for Barcelona fans is much sadder - their club has lost its position as the leader in La Liga and now the Catalans have to catch up with the leaders. Without an effective striker, there is no point in dreaming of regaining the championship. So does our team captain have anything to worry about?

title: And yet PiS will not receive the money? Schetyna talks about a loophole in the regulations
description: Senator of the Civic Coalition and former Speaker of the Sejm Grzegorz Schetyna has doubts about the decision of the State Electoral Commission regarding the subsidy for Law and Justice. In an interview for RMF 24, the politician emphasized that the responsibility for this decision currently rests on the shoulders of the Minister of Finance Andrzej Domański, who should not have paid the money to Jarosław Kaczyński's party. He also offered a solution to the problem.
